title: Business Live: Business reacts to May's Brexit speech - BBC News
summary: pound falls after theresa may brexit speech .
slough 'best town to work in uk ' .

documents.title: keep eu trade as it is until 2021 - may
text: keep eu trade as it is until 2021 - may

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it from us this week .
thanks for reading .
do join us on monday at 0600 when the business live page returns .

documents.title: wall street flat amid n korea war of words
text: us stocks finished a choppy day little changed as investors weighed how seriously to take the war of words over north korea .
president donald trump called north korean leader kim jong-un a `` madman '' who `` will be tested like never before ! ''
on twitter , after insults from kim earlier in the day .
the dow jones industrial average slipped 9 points to end the week at 22,349.59 .
the s & p 500 added 0.1 % to 2,502.22 , as did the nasdaq composite index which closed at 6,426.92 .

documents.title: zuckerberg court date dropped
text: facebook chief executive mark zuckerberg will not appear in court next week , after the company dropped a plan to create a new kind of stock .
investors had sued over the proposal , which would have allowed mr zuckerberg to retain voting control of the company but own a smaller percentage of its shares .

it is a structure that has been popular with founders of firms such as alphabet , but other investors , including pension funds , said facebook 's board breached its duty to represent shareholders when they approved it .
mr zuckerberg said he still intends to sell 35 million to 75 million shares over the next 18 months to fund his philanthropy .
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: macron responds to may speech
text: french president emmanuel macron has noted `` advances '' and `` openings '' in theresa may 's brexit speech .
but he still has concerns , as bbc politics editor laura kuenssberg points out
macron first eu leader to respond , says uk still needs to clarify 3 issues before talks can make progress ( ni , citz and the moolah )

documents.title: broken pact
text: fitness app pact , which promised members financial rewards for meeting their health goals , has settled accusations that it broke its promises .
the app let people set exercise and dietary goals , and charged them a penalty between $ 5 ( £ 3.70 ) and $ 50 if they failed to meet their target .
it pledged to share some of the `` fines '' with members who did reach their goals .
but the us federal trade commission said pact had now started to return money wrongly taken from subscribers .
pact - originally known as gympact - was launched in 2012 to help people meet fitness goals .
pledges were verified by using smartphone location data and photographs to prove members had been to the gym .

documents.title: time for brexit action , say businesses
text: time for brexit action , say businesses

documents.title: life after nafta
text: mexican foreign minister luis videgaray says that investors were growing optimistic about a favorable outcome to talks to revamp the north american free trade agreement , even as he suggested that mexico could bounce back if the negotiations collapse .
`` people are starting to understand that there could be life after nafta if the us withdraws , '' videgaray said in a speech at the council on foreign relations , according to a reuters report .
he spoke as negotiators from the united states , mexico and canada prepare to kick off the third round of talks on overhauling the trade deal under pressure from us .
president donald trump has repeatedly attacked nafta as a jobs killer and threatened to tear it up .
despite that tough talk , videgaray said markets are relatively sanguine about the situation .
`` many investments are happening and investors and markets are realizing that there 's a high chance that there 's going to be a good deal here , '' he said .
`` that was not priced in at the beginning of the year . ''

documents.title: watch : maggots on the menu
text: as the global population grows and more of us are eating meat and fish , there are concerns that the world 's resources ca n't keep up .
jason drew is an entrepreneur and environmentalist .
he has found a way to turn food waste into a maggot-based animal feed , which could offer a sustainable alternative .

documents.title: all change , perhaps
text: french transport company alstom , maker of high-speed trains , has said it is in talks with germany 's siemens over a possible railway sector tie-up .

following media reports that both companies were planning to merge their rail activities , alstom confirmed `` the existence of discussions with siemens relating to a possible tie-up between alstom and siemens 's mobility unit '' .
but it said no decision had been made .
the talks are a throwback to similar discussions between both companies in 2015 that were cut short when alstom instead signed an alliance with us giant general electric .
siemens , for its part , has been in talks with canada 's bombardier in recent months on closer cooperation .
according to the bloomberg news service , siemens could hand over its rail activities to alstom in exchange for a large stake in the french firm 's capital .
another scenario could involve the creation of a joint venture grouping both companies ' rail and signalling services .

documents.title: us markets remain in the red
text: wall street was still slightly lower in early afternoon trading as losses in healthcare and technology stocks were evened out by gains in energy and industrial stocks .
uncertainty over the us healthcare bill took a toll on insurers with unitedhealth sliding more than 2.3 % to weigh the most on the dow .
shares of other insurers aetna and humana also fell more than 1 % .
the s & p and the nasdaq indexes were weighed down by a 1.4 % fall in apple 's shares as the launch of the iphone 8 kicked off in a less lively mood in asia .
however , the losses in all three major indexes were capped by gains in energy and industrial stocks .
boeing and chevron rose about 0.5 % to support the dow .
in early afternoon trading , the dow was down 0.12 % at 22,331.4 points , while the s & p 500 was down 0.05 % at 2,499.2 .
the nasdaq was 0.07 % lower at 6,418.03 .

documents.title: may speech : 'lack of vision '
text: leave campaigner and businessman christopher nieper said theresa may 's brexit speech was `` thin on detail '' .
the managing director of womenswear manufacturer david nieper , said : `` what we are all waiting for is her vision for a trade deal .
we did n't see anything on that , and i was a little disappointed . ''
he told the bbc that further delay in agreeing a deal was just `` stalling '' , adding : `` in reality it 's more uncertainty . ''
he said : `` business is very good at adapting .
we work to a delivery date why ca n't the government work for a delivery date in the same way .
we can be ready . ''
he feels that business should now plan for `` no deal , and plan for world trade organisation rules '' .
but this should n't be a problem , he said .
`` the tariffs paid under wto rules are dwarfed by the currency advantage of the weaker pound , which has helped exporters like his company .
`` this is not a cliff-edge .
it 's a springboard .
theresa may should have said that , on the 31 march next year , we will be signing free trade deals with many , many other countries around the world . ''

documents.title: ftse up , sterling downmarkets divide after may 's speech
text: uk shares reversed early losses to finish higher as the pound lost ground against other currencies .
north korea 's threat to test a hydrogen bomb over the pacific had hit stocks in early trading , but the ftse 100 share index then recovered to close 47 points higher at 7,311 .
the pound slipped 0.4 % against the dollar to $ 1.352 , and fell 0.5 % against the euro to €1.131 .
markets were reacting to theresa may 's speech in florence .
the uk prime minister said there should be a two-year transition period after brexit , during which trade should continue on current terms .
the ftse 100 's rise took the index to a week 's high as the weaker pound boosted its mainly foreign-earning constituents .
among the main movers , smiths group dropped 5.6 % despite the conglomerate reporting a 17 % rise in profit to £ 528m for the year to 31 july .
analysts focused on smiths ' slight dip in underlying revenues , with morgan stanley describing it as `` disappointing '' .
after jumping more than 14 % on thursday , shares in johnson matthey continued to rise , climbing a further 1.2 % .

investors had cheered the company confirming its full-year sales guidance and the announcement of a £ 200m fund to invest in developing battery materials so it can benefit from the growth in electric cars .
uk government bond futures briefly rallied by around 15 ticks to a two-day high during may 's speech , before paring gains to trade at around the level they were before she started .

documents.title: 'the business voice has been heard'cbi responds to pm 's brexit speech
text: firms will welcome the proposal of a 'status quo ' transition period for business that averts a cliff-edge exit .
this mirrors exactly the cbi 's proposal made nearly 80 days ago and , if agreed by the eu , will protect jobs and investment on both sides of the channel .
millions of eu workers and their families in the uk need certainty and vice versa .
by committing to enshrine their eu rights into uk law goes some way to doing that but until agreement is reached , individuals will still not be clear what their future holds .
more tough choices and compromises await and listening to firms will help ensure agreement on a comprehensive version of what our future economic relationship with the eu will look like . ''

documents.title: 'people and prosperity'aerospace and defence trade body reacts to may 's brexit speech
text: an implementation period is essential and i welcome the prime minister 's proposal today for businesses to experience a one-step transition as part of a smooth and orderly process .
as the prime minister said , this transition period should be agreed as soon as possible , and i hope both sides seize the opportunity to make progress on this important issue .
substantive negotiations on the future relationship between the uk and eu must put people and prosperity at their heart .
this will require compromise on both sides and industry stands ready to help formulate detailed plans at all stages of the negotiations . ''

documents.title: may speech : the good news ? more city reaction to may 's speech
text: the fact that the pound is lower after the speech suggests that may failed to delver everything that was expected , including the rumoured divorce bill that the uk is willing to pay , although many believe it to be $ 20bn .
thus , the eu 's response to may 's speech is likely to be even more important for uk asset prices .
a weaker pound and news about the transitional period that the uk will target helped the ftse 100 to make a fresh weekly high during the speech .

the hope for investors ' is that confirmation of an implementation period after we leave the eu could foster economic confidence and protect the uk economy from weakening further next year and even falling into recession , which is good news for uk asset prices . ''

documents.title: may speech : 'business reserving judgement '
text: business leaders have been reacting to theresa may 's brexit address in florence .

adam marshall , director general of the british chambers of commerce , said business would judge the speech based on whether it helped `` break the stalemate '' between the uk and eu that has left companies `` counting the cost of uncertainty '' .

he said : `` the prime minister 's constructive tone and clearer offers , particularly on guarantees on eu citizens ' rights and uk contributions to the eu budget , represent an important and welcome effort to break the impasse of recent months , which has preoccupied many in the world of business . ''
but mr marshall said `` a significant majority '' of businesses wanted a transitional period that lasted longer than the two years the prime minster proposed in her speech in florence .

`` we will challenge both the uk government and the european commission over the coming months to agree a transition that lasts at least three years from the date of our formal exit from the eu , giving businesses enough time to prepare for a final deal , '' he said .

documents.title: uber : 'do n't delete the app '
text: so , with the company facing the loss of its london licence , should customers in the uk capital delete the app ?
`` absolutely not , '' says uk uber executive fred jones .
the firm is appealing against the decision through the courts and will continue to operate beyond 30 september - when the licence is due to expire .
he also urges uber 's 3.5 million london customers to write to london mayor sadiq khan to reconsider the decision .

documents.title: uber 'surprised ' by tfl ruling
text: uber executive fred jones has been visiting the bbc 's central london hq , expressing his `` surprise '' at the decision to strip its london licence .
mr jones , the firm 's head of cities for uk and ireland , says uber had passed its audits before the decision and had sought to co-operate with transport for london .
he says the firm is `` astounded '' at the decision from tfl and london mayor sadiq khan .
they `` caved into the pressure exerted by a small minority '' who want to limit consumer choice , he adds .

documents.title: pm speech hurts sterling
text: the pound fell to a low for the day against both the dollar and euro as investors reacted to prime minister 's theresa may 's brexit speech .
sterling was down 0.6 % versus the dollar at 1.350 , having been 0.2 % lower at the start of the pm 's address .
against the euro , the pound extended its losses to trade 0.8 % lower at 1.127 .
it takes the uk currency further away from the near 15-month highs it reached just last week amid signs the bank of england is likely to raise interest rates later this autumn .

documents.title: n korea casts cloud over shares
text: us stocks opened lower on friday as investors turned risk averse after north korea and the united states entered into a fresh war of words .
the dow jones began the trading day 0.07 % lower at 22,344.29 points .
and the nasdaq dropped 0.31 % to 6,402.67 .

documents.title: why blind travellers appreciate uber
text: amid the row over the rights and wrongs of uber , the bbc 's emma tracey says let 's not forget that there is a group of people in london who will certainly miss the service - blind travellers .
`` uber has taken advice and guidance from the royal national institute for blind people on how to make the app accessible .
disabled people who use the uber assist option expect to get a driver who is trained to be sympathetic to their needs .
`` ability to communicate with the driver pre-journey via call or text means you can tell them how best to spot you in the street , by looking out for a white stick or guide dog .
`` we can forward the journey details to a friend so that they can track our progress .
sometimes , as a blind passenger , it 's hard to know if a driver is milking the journey by taking you the long way .
`` sometimes road works , or other irregular situations , mean that even really short journeys are tricky for a blind person to navigate on foot .
uber drivers do n't mind short journeys , and there are always some about .
i have friends who use them daily for £ 4 runs .
`` pre-paying via the app , rather than using cash or by credit/debit card , is a big help .
sometimes notes are difficult to tell apart in a hurry , and it is tricky to know if someone is watching you put in your pin .

`` and finally ( possibly less importantly ) the rating system means that if the driver starts asking intrusive questions about your impairment - a large percentage of taxi drivers do - you can ask nicely for them to stop and they will .
`` uber may have detractors .
just do n't forget that there is a large constituency of users whose lives have been greatly improved by the service . ''
emma tracey , bbc ouch disability

documents.title: uber was given ample time to reassure regulator - khan
text: london 's mayor sadiq khan has been talking to the bbc about the uber ruling .
it was , he says , the right decision .
`` uber drivers , uber users should rightly be angry at uber for not playing by the rules .
the rules are there for a reason .
and tfl [ transport for london ] has got a really important role to perform in making sure those who operate private hire vehicles do it safety and securely .
`` and look , uber have had time to reassure tfl .

but tfl have big concerns around safety , in relation to criminal information not being passed onto police , in relation to the way medical examinations are performed by uber , in relation to enhanced checks , and also in relation to a device used to block the regulator . ''

documents.title: uber ruling is 'luddite '
text: tfl 's uber decision will be seen as `` luddite '' by millions of londoners and international visitors '' , says david leam of london first , a business lobby group .
it will also hit london 's reputation as a global tech hub , he says .

`` uber is now as much a part of london 's transport infrastructure as the northern line the issues raised by tfl should now be resolved with the company itself rather than dragged through the courts and the newspapers .
we need to show the world that london remains open for business . ''

documents.title: 'big human cost ' to uber decisionthe institute of directors says :
text: 'big human cost ' to uber decisionthe institute of directors says :

documents.title: grow up
text: the fashion industry is experiencing a revolution , with mermaids , unicorns , sparkles and vintage toys now all the rage in high street fashion shops .
products once considered to be `` too childish '' or alternative for women to wear are now all the rage .
moschino has just launched its my little pony collection for spring/summer 2018 at milan fashion week .
but the trend has led to renewed debate among consumers about whether wearing such fashion items is a sign of immaturity .
read more here .

documents.title: what next for uber ? bbc reporter theo leggett tweets
text: since they can keep operating during appeals and court challenges , they may never leave

documents.title: t-mobile and sprint 'close to merger deal '
text: america 's third and fourth biggest mobile networks are close to merging , reuters is reporting .
quoting sources , it said t-mobile had agreed the tentative terms of deal with sprint .
t-mobile owner deutsche telekom would own a majority stake in the new company , while japan 's softbank group - which controls sprint - would hold about 40-50 % .
if agreed , the deal would go ahead in october .
sprint declined to comment , while t-mobile did not immediately respond to requests for comment .

documents.title: not a stellar year for uber
text: transport for london 's decision not to renew uber 's licence to operate in the capital is just the latest in a very long list of controversies linked to the taxi hailing company .
the press association has rounded up some of the most notable from this year alone :

documents.title: what do you think about the uber ruling ?
text: is tfl 's decision to revoke uber 's licence in london regressive ?
or will it make the capital 's streets safer and fairer for drivers ?
let us know at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: uber ruling is 'perverse '
text: chris bryce , chief executive of the association of independent professionals and the self employed , says transport for london 's decision not to renew uber 's licence is `` perverse '' and will `` leave tens of thousands of hardworking , honest and dedicated self-employed drivers out of work '' .
ipse is calling on london mayor sadiq khan to `` think again , revoke his support for this decision and intervene to ensure drivers will be able to continue working , '' he says .
`` the self-employed simply want to earn a living without having to rely on the state . ''

documents.title: ftse 100 ticks up
text: after beginning the day with a slight fall , london 's benchmark index is in positive territory , gaining 0.2 % to 7278.39 points .
johnson matthey is top of the leader board , up 2.6 % , after seeing its biggest gain in almost a decade on thursday due to plans to invest £ 200m in next-generation battery technology .
it 's followed by standard life aberdeen , up 2.1 % , and astra zeneca , up 1.9 % .
the biggest faller is engineering firm smiths , down 4.4 % after reporting a fall in underlying revenue .

documents.title: frank field : uber ruling a game changer
text: frank field mp , chair of the work and pensions committee and vocal uber critic , says tfl 's decision to withdraw uber 's licence in london could be a game changer for the gig economy .
`` uber must now respond to tfl 's decision by totally resetting its business model .

this new model will need to be built upon two foundations : a safe and reliable service for every passenger ; and a living wage and fairer conditions for every driver who makes themselves available for work . ''

documents.title: tourism to uk rises , but outbound visits fall
text: the trend for more overseas visitors to the uk continues , but outbound numbers have slipped .
according to the ons , overseas residents made four million visits to the uk in july - up 6 % compared with the same month last year .
uk residents made 6.9 million trips abroad , down by 2 % .
the weakening of the pound since the brexit vote has made the uk a cheaper destination for travellers from abroad .

but patricia yates , from tourist promotion agency visitbritain , said currency was only part of the story : `` we know the weak pound helps , but it is not the motivator for first time visitors - most people overseas do not know what the exchange rate is . ''

documents.title: pound edges back
text: the pound has edged back ahead of theresa may 's major speech on brexit in florence at 2pm .
it 's down 0.3 % against the dollar at $ 1.35460 .
it 's also 0.5 % lower against the euro at 1.13210 euros .

documents.title: uber rejects safety claims
text: uber 's london gm also rejects tfl claims that it endangers public safety .
tom elvidge says : drivers who use uber are licensed by transport for london and have been through the same enhanced dbs background checks as black cab drivers .
`` our pioneering technology has gone further to enhance safety with every trip tracked and recorded by gps .
we have always followed tfl rules on reporting serious incidents and have a dedicated team who work closely with the metropolitan police . ''

documents.title: uber plans 'immediate challenge ' to decision
text: tom elvidge , general manager of uber in london , says : `` by wanting to ban our app from the capital transport for london and the mayor have caved in to a small number of people who want to restrict consumer choice .
`` if this decision stands , it will put more than 40,000 licensed drivers out of work and deprive londoners of a convenient and affordable form of transport .
to defend the livelihoods of all those drivers , and the consumer choice of millions of londoners who use our app , we intend to immediately challenge this in the courts . ''

documents.title: tfl outlines uber decision
text: transport for london ( tfl ) says its regulation of london 's taxi and private hire trades is `` designed to ensure passenger safety '' .
it says : `` private hire operators must meet rigorous regulations , and demonstrate to tfl that they do so , in order to operate .
tfl must also be satisfied that an operator is fit and proper to hold a licence .
`` tfl has concluded that uber london limited is not fit and proper to hold a private hire operator licence . ''
it says its areas of concerns about uber are :

documents.title: uber can appeal
text: uber has 21 days to appeal the decision not to review its licence , says transport for london .

documents.title: tfl concerned at uber 's 'lack of corporate responsibility '
text: transport for london says that uber 's conduct demonstrates a lack of corporate responsibility in relation to a number of issues which have potential public safety and security implications .

documents.title: uber 'not fit and proper ' to hold licence
text: transport for london has concluded that the taxi sharing company uber is not `` fit and proper '' to hold a private hire operator licence .

documents.title: breakingtransport for london will not renew uber licence
text: transport for london has just announced that it will not renew uber 's licence to operate in london .

documents.title: eurozone sees 'burst of activity '
text: the eurozone economy ended the third quarter of the year on a strong note , a survey has indicated .
the ihs markit composite purchasing managers ' index ( pmi ) suggested private businesses grew faster than expected in september .
it said manufacturers had enjoyed their best month since early 2011 .
read the full story here .

documents.title: pound ticks lower
text: the key points expected in prime minister theresa may 's speech later on friday have been reported this morning .
but that does n't necessarily mean a calm day for the pound which is currently trading down on the dollar .
the temptation is to say that because much of the content of the speech has been widely reported on already , that the impact on the currency will be small .
however , fx options markets are pricing in quite a premium for the moves in the currency today and previously we 've seen sterling be quite sensitive to speeches from theresa may .

documents.title: never mind the election , here 's brexit
text: germans are , naturally , rather busy with their national elections which take place on sunday .
but the political class and business leaders are keeping an eye on what theresa may will say in florence , says bbc business reporter rob young who is in berlin today .

the cdu mp , jurgen hardt , who is a close ally of chancellor angela merkel , says there is still a huge gap '' between the expectations in britain about what brexit will look like and the reality as he predicts it .
brexit is foolish and was based on false or incomplete information . ''

jorg rocholl , the president of the business school esmt berlin and an economic adviser to germany 's finance ministry , said today 's speech is a very important step '' - that is , if includes the expected commitment to continue paying in to eu budget for another two years after brexit .
so far there has n't been a real statement on the british side on whether there 's a willingness to pay , '' he says .
but he cautions this wo n't be enough to impress european governments .
there are also commitments that go beyond 2020 .
here there 's an expectation on the german and the european side that britain will keep ( to ) those commitments . ''
that means handing over even more money well into the 2020s .
that wo n't go down well with many in the uk .
author: Rob Young
Business presenter

documents.title: may speech could move pound
text: the pound is trading at $ 1.35710 against the dollar , near to a 15 month high as markets begin to anticipate a softer brexit .
however , it has also fallen 0.6 % against the euro since the start of friday .
connor campbell , an analyst at spreadex , says theresa may 's major brexit speech in florence will determine how it performs for the rest of the day .
`` not only what she proposes , but how the eu reacts to the comments - the fact she is going to ask michel barnier and co. to be 'imaginative and creative ' suggests it may not go down well . ''

documents.title: brexit talks 'not satisfactory '
text: the status of the brexit talks are `` not satisfactory '' says steffan kampeter , head of the german employers organisation , the bda .

speaking to the bbc 's today programme ahead of theresa may speech on friday , he said : `` we need a fair deal of divorce with the uk and we need a fair and proper structure of transition leading into a future framework which gives us opportunities . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: l'oreal shares rise on ownership speculation
text: shares in l'oreal have risen after the death of 94-year-old billionaire liliane bettencourt , who had the largest stake in the cosmetics group and whose passing may alter its ownership structure .

food giant nestle , which owns just over 23 % of l'oreal , had agreed with bettencourt 's family that the two parties could not increase their stakes during her lifetime and for at least six months after her death .
`` speculation will now inevitably be re-ignited around nestle 's intentions towards its l'oreal stake , '' analysts at jefferies wrote in a research note .
`` this holds out the prospect of l'oreal either buying in the stake , or perhaps even nestle buying l'oreal outright . ''
l'oreal shares gained 4 % on friday while nestle was up 1 % .

documents.title: why apple launches are losing their luster
text: queues at the iphone 8 launch in london seemed smaller than last year , and years before that , according to shopper will , who collected his model from apple 's regent street store on friday .
`` it 's because the upgrades have become quite iterative , '' he told business live .
chris , who also attended the launch , agreed .
`` the excitement around these launches is n't what it used to be .
it certainly does n't feel like 2007 , it 's a part of everyday life now .
apple phones are n't the revolution they once were . ''

documents.title: thin queues for apple launch ?
text: an apple launch is often accompanied by a sea of enthusiasts queuing up at its stores to get their hands on the latest product .
not so for the launch of the iphone 8 on friday , although some suggested this is because apple will release its x phone in just a month .
the more advanced model is likely to attract more attention than the 8 , which offers only iterative changes to apple 's previous phone .

documents.title: french business activity rises
text: like germany , french business activity grew strongly in september .
ihs markit 's composite purchasing managers index , which covers the services and manufacturing sector , produced a reading of 57.2 from 55.2 in august .
it is the highest level since may 2011 .
ihs markit economist alex gill says : `` encouragingly , private sector growth appears to be broad-based , with similar rates of expansion recorded in both the manufacturing and services sectors . ''

documents.title: german growth surges
text: germany 's manufacturing and services sectors grew at the fastest rate in nearly six and a half years , according to new data .
markit 's flash composite purchasing managers ' index found that activity in both sectors , which together account for more than two thirds of the german economy , rose to 57.8 from 55.8 in august .
the reading is the highest since april 2011 and ahead of economists ' forecasts for a reading of 55.8 .
the results have emerged ahead of germany 's general election on sunday when chancellor angela merkel is expected to be re-elected for a fourth term .

documents.title: kingfisher shares rebound
text: the 100 share index has kicked off the day with a small fall - down 0.16 % to 7,252 .
the biggest gainer is kingfisher , owner of b & q and screwfix , up further ground after wednesday 's fall following its interim results - now up 1 % .
but specialist instruments group smiths industries results go down badly , despite a 17 % rise in profits and turnover coming in just shy of expectations .
shares are 3 % lower .
in currencies , the pound is marginally higher against the dollar at $ 1.35910 and is down 0.39 % against the euro at 1.13300 euros .

documents.title: japan 's yen rises after n korea warning
text: the yen edged up 0.3 % against the dollar on friday after north korea suggested it might test a hydrogen bomb over the pacific ocean .
it is not unusual for japan 's currency to climb during a crisis , as investors seek a safe haven until risks ease .
but this crisis is slightly different , because the additional risks could be to japan itself .
analysts , however , say things would have to be catastrophic for investors to flee the currency .
read more

documents.title: decision day for uber
text: uber could learn on friday whether transport for london ( tfl ) will grant the taxi hailing company a new five-year operating licence .
sky news reports that if tfl curtails or rejects the new licence it would remove thousands of taxi drivers from the capital 's streets .

documents.title: one man and his dogbbc technology correspondent rory cellan-jones tweets
text: dog determined that nobody interrupts my @ twitterid broadcast about attitudes to fake news and internet regulation
i hope your dog does n't play the piano

documents.title: a pivotal moment for facebook ?
text: facebook 's decision to share 3,000 russia-linked political adverts with us investigators could be a pivotal moment for the firm , says the bbc 's media editor amol rajan .
`` this is quite a change of position for facebook because this sort of data was previously deemed confidential , '' he told today .
it follows claims the russian government tried to sway last year 's us election .
boss mark zuckerberg has said he wants to create `` a new standard for transparency for online political ads '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: asian markets slip on n korea threats
text: asian stocks slid lower on friday after north korea said it might test a hydrogen bomb in the pacific ocean and escalated a war of words with us president donald trump .
japan 's nikkei edged -0.25 % lower to 20,296.45 , while south korea 's kospi slipped 0.74 % to 2,388.71 .
hong kong 's hang seng also fell 0.74 % to 27,902.69 .
singapore and australia bucked the trend , with major indexes in the two countries edging higher .

documents.title: london stock markets open lower
text: the ftse 100 has opened down 13.39 points at 7,250.51 .
the ftse 250 is also lower , off 16.01 points at 19,402.32 .

documents.title: slough - the best town to work in the uk ?
text: it may be better known as the home of david brent from the office , but slough has now topped a poll of the best towns to work in the uk .
nancy lalor of the slough chambers of commerce does n't think it 's a big surprise .
lots of corporates have offices there and it has `` an amazing trading estate '' , she told radio 5 .
there is also a huge amount of new development going on and a `` real buzz in the town '' .
slough may have had a bad reputation in the past , she accepts , but it 's now `` on the up '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: a league of its own
text: businesses like stability and nothing would be more stable than a fourth term for germany 's angela merkel .

steffan kampeter , who runs german employers organisation the bda , says : `` german businesses do n't decide who is ruling the country but we have clear expectations for the next period of four years , on what the government should do to improve competitiveness . ''
he says : `` german businesses are performing good , they are performing [ at ] champions league [ level ] .
but as you see by the example of the german football teams in the champions league , they do not win all games .
we need to make the euro strong again with a strong german contribution . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: a 'terrible week ' for ryanair
text: morning !

documents.title: merkel v the euro
text: kathleen brooks , research director for city index , says that oddschecker is putting the likelihood of angela merkel being re-elected as germany 's chancellor at 94 % probability .
`` if she was n't that would be a massive upset and we could see big declines in both the euro and in german equities , '' she tells the bbc 's today programme .
`` if she does win , it will have a much more muted impact and actually markets are moving much more on the economic growth outlook .
`` right now , the growth in the euro could impact economic growth further down the line .
does the euro matter more than merkel ?
certainly in terms of european equity markets that seems to be the case . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: smiths - how it began
text: for those unfamiliar with smiths , it describes itself as `` a world leader in the practical application of advanced technologies [ and for ] threat & contraband detection '' .
one of its divisions , smiths detection , is the world 's largest manufacturer of sensors for the detection of explosives , weapons , chemical agents , narcotics and contraband .
the group also makes seals , medical devices and industrial components .
it began life as a company in piccadilly , london , in 1851 and says it is the only victorian era company on the ftse 100 - a proud boast indeed .

documents.title: statutory revenue up at smiths , underlying sales fall
text: statutory sales are up at engineering group smiths , a maker of sensors , speedometers , components and seals .
in the year ended 31 july , revenue climbed 11 % to £ 3.3bn and pre tax profits jumped 17 % to £ 528m .
however , its underlying revenue slipped .
chief executive andy reynolds smith said the firm had placed a `` relentless focus '' on operational efficiency and cash generation .

documents.title: saga on track to hit full year forecasts
text: saga , the insurance and travel specialist for the over 50s , has reported interim pre-tax profits down 6.3 % at £ 103m .
revenue for the six months to july was marginally lower at £ 435.4m .
the company says that it is growing , `` has good momentum and is on track to deliver in line with expectations for the full year '' .
it adds that its new ship - spirit of discovery - will arrive in june 2019 and pre-sales are `` very strong '' .

documents.title: l'oreal heiress dies
text: in case you missed it , overnight it emerged that liliane bettencourt , the heiress to cosmetics firm l'oreal and the world 's richest woman , died aged 94 .
ms bettencourt 's assets , including her holding stake in the cosmetics company , were placed in a trust controlled by her daughter .
read more here .

documents.title: are ryanair pilots being prissy ?
text: ryanair boss michael o'leary has called some pilots precious '' after they demanded better pay and working conditions .
and according to conor mccarthy , a former operations director at ryanair , he may have a point .
the aerospace consultant says : `` i have some sympathy .
here you have people who are paid in excess of £ 100,000 a year and they get good time off between their roster patterns . ''
aircraft are also a lot safer and more reliable than 20 years ago thanks to investment by airlines .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: german car industry under pressure
text: on sunday , germany will hold its general election .

while chancellor angela merkel is expected to be re-elected , questions remain such as who will make up a coalition as well as the future of germany 's car industry - currently engulfed in scandals over emissions , cartel-like behaviour , and claims of a cosy relationship with the government .
a spokeswoman for germany 's lobbycontrol , says : `` we have many cases of revolving door moves , especially of those close to chancellor angela merkel .
her former state minister is now head lobbyist for daimler for example . ''

mrs merkel has promised to take action against the car industry but a spokesman for the rival social democratic party says : `` it is a huge scandal , probably the biggest scandal germany has known in many years . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: more turbulence for ryanair ?
text: ryanair 's shares fell 5 % this week after it cancelled thousands of flights and it could face more trouble as its pilots demand better pay , says cityindex 's kathleen brooks .
the company has been able to offer its cheap deals by cutting costs .
but that will become much harder if it has to offer better wages and conditions .
`` this is is n't just going to affect ryanair .
many other airlines have emulated its model of cutting costs and making pilots work longer hours , so higher labour costs are going to be a problem for all airlines i think . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: where now for the pound ?
text: can the pound sustain its recent upward trajectory , asks cmc markets 's chief market analyst michael hewson ?
that depends on theresa may and her speech at the santa maria novella church in florence this afternoon .

she is expected to make proposals on the rights of eu citizens , as well as making a budget proposal that will ensure that there is no budget shortfall for the remainder of the current eu budget period , which goes up to 2020 .

the offer is likely to be conditional on continued transitional access to the single market and customs union over the same period , while there could be a request to open talks on trade , something that in the case of the irish border is interlinked .
a transition arrangement would also help in buying more time to come to a more comprehensive deal .
if the markets like what they hear and there is n't a negative response from the eu then the recent rally in the pound could extend further .
